properties.name: Macclesfield Bank
properties.description: Elongated submerged atoll, 130 km long x 70 km wide. Entirely underwater with depths of 11-100 meters. Dangerous to navigation.
properties.historical_note: Hazardous area during WWII submarine operations

properties.name: Dangerous Ground (Spratly Area)
properties.description: Large area with numerous low islands, cays, sunken reefs, and atolls. Poorly charted. Reefs rise abruptly from depths >1000m.
properties.historical_note: Major navigation hazard for WWII submarines. Many uncharted shoals and reefs.

properties.name: Scarborough Shoal (Huangyan Island)
properties.description: Triangular-shaped coral reef. Completely submerged at high tide.

properties.name: Paracel Islands (Xisha Islands)
properties.description: Group of islands, reefs, banks and shoals. Strategic area during WWII.

properties.name: Pratas Reef (Dongsha)
properties.description: Circular atoll approximately 2.8 km across. Japanese seaplane base during WWII.
properties.historical_note: Japanese military installation, target area for Allied submarines

properties.name: Reed Bank (Recto Bank)
properties.description: Large tablemount in the Spratly Islands area. Shallow waters.
